      • computeBlock

        public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                int inOff,
                byte[] outBytes,
                int outOff)
        Computes the AES permutation on the given block.

        Specified by:
        computeBlock in interface PseudorandomFunction
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute.
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array.
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of compute.
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from.

      • optimizedCompute

        public void optimizedCompute(byte[] inBytes,
                    byte[] outBytes)
        Computes the AES permutation on the given array. The given array length does not have to be the size of the block but a MUST be aligned to the block size. The optimized compute block divide the given input into blocks and compute each one of them separately. The output array will contain a concatenation of all the results of computing the blocks.
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute.
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of compute.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given input is not aligned to block size.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given input and output are not in the same size.

      • computeBlock

        public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                int inOff,
                int inLen,
                byte[] outBytes,
                int outOff,
                int outLen)
                  throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function is provided in the interface especially for the sub-family PrfVaryingIOLength, which may have variable input/output lengths. Since both Input and output variables are fixed this function should not normally be called. If the user still wants to use this function, the input and output lengths should be the same as the result of getBlockSize, otherwise, throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        computeBlock in interface PseudorandomFunction
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute.
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array.
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of compute.
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from.
        inLen - the length of the input array
        outLen - the length of the output array
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException

      • computeBlock

        public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                int inOffset,
                int inLen,
                byte[] outBytes,
                int outOffset)
                  throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function is provided in the interface especially for the sub-family PrfVaryingInputLength, which may have variable input length. Since this is a prp, the input length is fixed with the block size, so this function normally shouldn't be called. If the user still wants to use this function, the input length should be the same as the block size. Otherwise, throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        computeBlock in interface PseudorandomFunction
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute.
        inLen - the length of the input array.
        inOffset - input offset in the inBytes array.
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of invert.
        outOffset - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from.
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException

      • invertBlock

        public void invertBlock(byte[] inBytes,
               int inOff,
               byte[] outBytes,
               int outOff)
        Inverts the AES permutation on the given block.
        Specified by:
        invertBlock in interface PseudorandomPermutation
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute.
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array.
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of invert.
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from.

      • optimizedInvert

        public void optimizedInvert(byte[] inBytes,
                   byte[] outBytes)
        Inverts the AES permutation on the given array. The given array length does not have to be the size of the block but a MUST be aligned to the block size. The optimized invert block divides the given input into blocks and inverts each one of them separately. The output array will contain a concatenation of all the results of inverting the blocks.
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to invert.
        outBytes - output bytes. The inverted bytes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given input is not aligned to block size.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given input and output are not in the same size.

      • invertBlock

        public void invertBlock(byte[] inBytes,
               int inOff,
               byte[] outBytes,
               int outOff,
               int len)
                 throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function is provided in the interface especially for the sub-family PrpVarying, which may have variable input/output lengths. Since in this case, both input and output variables are fixed this function should not normally be called. If the user still wants to use this function, the specified argument len should be the same as the result of getBlockSize, otherwise, throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        invertBlock in interface PseudorandomPermutation
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to invert.
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array.
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of invert.
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from.
        len - the length of the input and the output.
        Throws:
        IllegalBlockSizeException.
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
